name: blueprint
description: 8 specialized AI agents that transform your app idea into a complete, annotated build brief — brand identity, API contracts, database schema, TDD strategy, UI spec, and a one-shot master prompt. Supports Gemini, OpenAI, Groq, and Azure OpenAI.

enumDescriptions: Azure OpenAI — your deployed Azure OpenAI resource
blueprint.provider.markdownDescription:
The LLM provider to use for all Blueprint agents.

Configure credential fields for the chosen provider below.

blueprint.gemini.apiKey.markdownDescription:
**Gemini API Key** — get yours at [aistudio.google.com](https://aistudio.google.com/).

_Required when `blueprint.provider` is `gemini`._

blueprint.gemini.model.markdownDescription:
Gemini model to use.

- `gemini-2.0-flash` — Fast, recommended for most projects
- `gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp` — Slower but deeper reasoning
- `gemini-1.5-pro` — Highest quality output

blueprint.openai.apiKey.markdownDescription:
**OpenAI API Key** — get yours at [platform.openai.com](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys).

_Required when `blueprint.provider` is `openai`._

blueprint.openai.model.markdownDescription:
OpenAI model to use.

- `gpt-4o` — Best quality, recommended
- `gpt-4o-mini` — Faster and cheaper
- `gpt-4-turbo` — Strong reasoning

blueprint.openai.baseUrl.markdownDescription: **OpenAI Base URL** — override for custom proxies or OpenAI-compatible endpoints. Leave as default for standard OpenAI usage.

blueprint.groq.apiKey.markdownDescription:
**Groq API Key** — get yours at [console.groq.com](https://console.groq.com/).

_Required when `blueprint.provider` is `groq`._

blueprint.groq.model.markdownDescription:
Groq model to use.

- `llama-3.3-70b-versatile` — Best quality on Groq, recommended
- `llama-3.1-8b-instant` — Ultra-fast, lighter tasks
- `mixtral-8x7b-32768` — Long context window

blueprint.azure.apiKey.markdownDescription:
**Azure OpenAI API Key** — found in your Azure Portal under your OpenAI resource → Keys and Endpoint.

_Required when `blueprint.provider` is `azure-openai`._

blueprint.azure.endpoint.markdownDescription:
**Azure OpenAI Endpoint** — e.g. `https://my-resource.openai.azure.com`

Found in Azure Portal → your OpenAI resource → Endpoint.

blueprint.azure.deploymentName.markdownDescription: **Azure Deployment Name** — the name you gave your model deployment in Azure AI Studio (e.g. `gpt-4o-deployment`).

blueprint.azure.apiVersion.markdownDescription: **Azure OpenAI API Version** — use the latest preview version for best features.
